about.name: Erin Berg
about.title: Software Engineer
about.description: Erin Berg is a computer science student based in Boston aspiring to work as a software engineer in the biotech field. She is a senior at Boston College working towards a BS in Computer Science with a concentration in Bioinformatics. She likes the idea of using computers to benefit people's health. When she's not studying, she enjoys cooking, running, podcasts, traveling, backpacking, and skiing.

projects.title: Optimizing Data Mining Techniques to Improve Breast Cancer Predictions
projects.authors: Erin Berg, Dylan Nadeau, and Kyle Tan
projects.description: In this paper, we discuss and analyze how accurately we can predict whether a patient has breast cancer based on attributes that any woman can obtain from a routine checkup. Our aim was to identify the optimal conditions for several classification tasks and enhance the one that produced the best results. Classification tasks that were implemented included Artificial Neural Networks, Support Vector Machines, and Logistic Regression.

projects.title: ListMaker Interactive Game
projects.authors: Erin Berg, Matthieu Tapolsky, Charlie Utsch
projects.description: ListMaker is an interactive game to teach students about linked lists. We used HTML, CSS, and Javascript to create both a website and the game that will give students a broader understanding of linked lists and their applications.

projects.title: 2012 NFL Season: Sentiment Analysis of Game Outcomes and Predicting Wins Using Fansâ€™ Tweets
projects.authors: Erin Berg, Keith Carroll, Courtney Peterson, and John Whalen
projects.description: The goals of this project were to find connection between fan sentiment and the football game outcome as well as predict who ended up winning based on tweets after a game. We used post-game tweets from the 2012 NFL season, analyzed, and classified them to obtain our results.
